pullRequest.body:
This fixes algebraize tactic to work better when it is pointing to a (possibly custom) constructor/theorem giving the algebra property from the corresponding ringhom property. As an application we apply this to the new `IsStandardSmooth`, `RingHom` property.

---

GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph

|Files|Import difference|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ Algebra.testProperty4`
`+ IsStandardSmooth.toAlgebra`
`+ IsStandardSmoothOfRelativeDimension.toAlgebra`
`+ RingHom.testProperty4`
`+ testProperty4.toAlgebra`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```

</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

Here are the [benchmark results](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/run-detail/d8998fc7-e7dd-4b6e-9712-55f5070fa725) for commit 3d51efccb44977e75b710b91207c5d9a08833c73.
There were [no significant changes](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/compare/5d123148-9253-40fc-bf75-6d8146d38ac3/to/d8998fc7-e7dd-4b6e-9712-55f5070fa725) against commit ede775853cc9f271a9fcf1475dec887f82544e30.

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11384140168/job/31671215954)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11384140168/job/31671215635)

Does this mean that `algebraize` does not check that this name exists already?
Should this promise be checked in CI?

I feel the error message is already quite good, if this does not exist, then any call to algebraize which tries to add this property will have the error message e.g.:
`unknown constant 'RingHom.IsStandardSmooth.toAlgebra.asdf'`
I think you can get rid of another `letI` on line 57, using this one.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(Algebraize): Fix algebraize tactic
